com.teamboid.twitterapi.client

Class Authorizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.teamboid.twitterapi.client.Authorizer

  • public class Authorizer
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to authenticate accounts and get logged in instances of Twitter
    Author:
    Aidan Follestad

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Authorizer.DebugLevel 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Authorizer create(java.lang.String consumer, java.lang.String secret, java.lang.String callback)
      Intializes a new Authorizer for generating authenticated Twitter instances.
      Twitter getAuthorizedInstance(java.lang.String verifier)
      The method called after your receive a callback from the web browser (after using getUrl()).
      Twitter getAuthorizedInstance(java.lang.String accessKey, java.lang.String accessSecret)
      This method is used to get an authorized Twitter instance if you had already gotten authorization previously and stored the returned access token.
      java.lang.String getAuthorizeUrl()
      The initial step of authentication, returns the URL of Twitter's authorization page that you must open in the web browser.
      Twitter getUnauthorizedInstance()
      This method is used to get an un-authorized Twitter instance; it will not have permission to request protected resources (any functions that require you to be logged in).
      Authorizer setDebugMode(Authorizer.DebugLevel debug)
      Sets whether or not debug is on, and what level of output it's creates.
      Authorizer setUseSSL(boolean ssl)
      Deprecated. 
      Use Twitter.setSslEnabled(boolean) instead.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static Authorizer create(java.lang.String consumer,
                java.lang.String secret,
                java.lang.String callback)
        Intializes a new Authorizer for generating authenticated Twitter instances.
        Parameters:
        consumer - The OAuth consumer of your application that's registered on dev.twitter.com.
        secret - The OAuth secret of your application that's registered on dev.twitter.com.
        callback - The callback URL called after the user authorizes their account on the web page returned from getUrl().
        Returns:
        A new Authorizer instance

      • getUnauthorizedInstance

        public Twitter getUnauthorizedInstance()
        This method is used to get an un-authorized Twitter instance; it will not have permission to request protected resources (any functions that require you to be logged in).

      • getAuthorizedInstance

        public Twitter getAuthorizedInstance(java.lang.String accessKey,
                            java.lang.String accessSecret)
        This method is used to get an authorized Twitter instance if you had already gotten authorization previously and stored the returned access token.
        Parameters:
        accessKey - The access key previously stored.
        accessSecret - The access secret preeviously stored.
        Returns:
        An authenticated Twitter instance.

      • getAuthorizedInstance

        public Twitter getAuthorizedInstance(java.lang.String verifier)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        The method called after your receive a callback from the web browser (after using getUrl()).
        Parameters:
        verifier - The oauth_verifier paramter sent from the browser through the callback.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getAuthorizeUrl

        public java.lang.String getAuthorizeUrl()
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        The initial step of authentication, returns the URL of Twitter's authorization page that you must open in the web browser. When they login and click 'Authorize', the callback you specified in the constructor will be invoked. Make sure your app is set up to receive this callback and use the callback() method.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setUseSSL

        public Authorizer setUseSSL(boolean ssl)
        Deprecated. Use Twitter.setSslEnabled(boolean) instead.
        Sets whether or not SSL will be used with requests to Twitter. Defaults as true.

      • setDebugMode

        public Authorizer setDebugMode(Authorizer.DebugLevel debug)
        Sets whether or not debug is on, and what level of output it's creates.
